description: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 â€“ three-letter country codes
source: International Organization for Standardization

description: Geographic location
source: Our World in Data

description: Year of observation
source: Our World in Data

description: Annual production-based emissions of carbon dioxide (CO2), measured in million tonnes per year.
source: Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center (CDIAC) and Global Carbon Project

description: Percentage change in CO2 emissions from one year relative to the previous year.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center (CDIAC) and Global Carbon Project

description: Annual change in CO2 emissions from one year relative to the previous year, measured in million tonnes.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center (CDIAC) and Global Carbon Project

description: Annual consumption-based CO2 emissions, measured in million tonnes per year.
source: Global Carbon Project

description: Net CO2 emissions embedded in trade; this is the net difference between CO2 embedded in exported and imported goods, measured in million tonnes.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on Global Carbon Project

description: CO2 emissions embedded in trade, given as a percentage of national production-based emissions.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on Global Carbon Project

description: Average per capita CO2 emissions, measured in tonnes per year.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on CDIAC and Global Carbon Project; and Gapminder and UN population estimates

description: Per capita consumption-based CO2 emissions, measured in tonnes per year.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on Global Carbon Project and UN Population estimates

description: National or regional annual CO2 emissions, measured as a percentage of the global total
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center (CDIAC) and Global Carbon Project

description: Cumulative emissions of CO2 from 1751 through to the given year, measured in million tonnes.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center (CDIAC) and Global Carbon Project

description: National or regional annual cumulative CO2 emissions, measured as a share of the global total
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center (CDIAC) and Global Carbon Project

description: CO2 emissions measured per unit of gross domestic product. GDP is adjusted for inflation and cross-country price differences (PPP-adjusted).
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center (CDIAC) and Global Carbon Project; and Maddison Project Database

description: Consumption-based CO2 emissions measured per unit of gross domestic product. GDP is adjusted for inflation and cross-country price differences (PPP-adjusted).
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on the Global Carbon Project and Maddison Project Database

description: CO2 emissions measured per unit of energy consumed.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on Global Carbon Project and BP Statistical Review of World Energy

description: CO2 emissions from cement production, measured in million tonnes.
source: Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center (CDIAC) and Global Carbon Project

description: CO2 emissions from coal production, measured in million tonnes.
source: Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center (CDIAC) and Global Carbon Project

description: CO2 emissions from gas flaring, measured in million tonnes.
source: Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center (CDIAC) and Global Carbon Project

description: CO2 emissions from gas production, measured in million tonnes.
source: Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center (CDIAC) and Global Carbon Project

description: CO2 emissions from oil production, measured in million tonnes.
source: Carbon Dioxide Information Analysis Center (CDIAC) and Global Carbon Project

description: Per capita CO2 emissions from cement production, measured in tonnes.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on CDIAC, Global Carbon Project and UN Population estimates

description: Per capita CO2 emissions from coal production, measured in tonnes.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on CDIAC, Global Carbon Project and UN Population estimates

description: Per capita CO2 emissions from flaring, measured in tonnes.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on CDIAC, Global Carbon Project and UN Population estimates

description: Per capita CO2 emissions from gas production, measured in tonnes.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on CDIAC, Global Carbon Project and UN Population estimates

description: Per capita CO2 emissions from oil production, measured in tonnes.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on CDIAC, Global Carbon Project and UN Population estimates

description: Annual greenhouse gas emissions, measured in million tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalents.
source: CAIT Climate Data Explorer

description: Greenhouse gas emissions per capita, measured in tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalents.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on CAIT Climate Data Explorer and UN Population estimates

description: Annual methane emissions, measured in million tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalents.
source: CAIT Climate Data Explorer

description: Methane emissions per capita, measured in tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalents.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on CAIT Climate Data Explorer and UN Population estimates

description: Annual nitrous oxide emissions, measured in million tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalents.
source: CAIT Climate Data Explorer

description: Nitrous oxide emissions per capita, measured in tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalents.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on CAIT Climate Data Explorer and UN Population estimates

description: Primary energy consumption, measured in terawatt-hours per year.
source: BP Statistical Review of World Energy

description: Primary energy consumption per capita, measured in kilowatt-hours per year.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on BP Statistical Review of World Energy and UN Population estimates

description: Primary energy consumption per unit of gross domestic product, measured in kilowatt-hours per international-$.
source: Calculated by Our World in Data based on BP Statistical Review of World Energy and Maddison Project Database

description: Total population
source: Gapminder and UN Population estimates

description: Total real gross domestic product, inflation-adjusted
source: Maddison Project Database
